name: 技術創新與傳承研究
description: The objectives of this course：  1. To have in-depth understanding of the dynamics of innovation  2. To familiarize with how technological innovation strategy is crafted  3. To expose to the well designed processes for implementing an innovation strategy
goals: To have in-depth understanding of the dynamics of innovation
To familiarize with how technological innovation strategy is crafted
To expose to the well designed processes for implementing an innovation strategy
syllabus:
​Course orientation & Student grouping  
  
Ch1. Introduction & Ch2. Sources of Innovation  
Opening Case: Getting an Inside Look: Given Imaging’s Camera Pill  
  
Film Watching: Enron-The Smartest Guys in the room  
  
Ch3. Types and Patterns of Innovation  
Opening Case: Honda and Hybrid Electric Vehicles  
  
Ch4. Standards Battles and Design Dominance  
Opening Case: The Rise of Microsoft  
  
Ch5. Timing of Entry  
Opening Case: The Personal Digital Assistant Industry In the Beginning  
  
Ch6. Defining the Organization’s Strategic Direction  
Opening Case: Genzyme’s Focus on Orphan Drugs  
  
Ch7. Choosing Innovation Projects  
Opening Case: Boeing’s Sonic Cruiser  
  
Mid-term Exam  
  
Film Watching: Guns, Germs, and Steel  
  
Ch8. Collaboration Strategies  
Opening Case: The XenoMouse  
  
Ch9. Projecting Innovation  
Opening Case: The Digital Music Distribution Revolution Fraunhofer and MP3  
  
Ch10. Organizing for Innovation  
Opening Case: Procter & Gamble’s “Organization 2005”  
  
Ch11. Managing the New Product Development Process  
Opening Case: frog design  
  
Ch12. Managing New Product Development Teams  
Opening Case: New Product Development at Dell Computer  
  
Ch13. Crafting a Development Strategy  
Opening Case: Deployment Tactics in the U.S. Video Game Industry
